Resources for Beginner and Advanced

26/08/2017 #resources
Note : There are a lots of free resources and I bet I will grew over times. I am not even uses all of these resources. So just pick a few. Learn it, go with it!
Other Lists Of Resources:
  • awesome (Really Good! )
  • Free Programming Books (Good! )
  • Free Science Books

  • 700+ Free Stuff on The Internet
  • List of the best free things online everyone can take advantage of
  • Web Development Study Resources by dragaCode
  • Nice list by @3way in our community
  • The blog post by @foo-dogsquared
Online Educational Websites
  • brilliant.org (Pretty nice, tech you computer algorithms. Also have logic and math course. Recommended )
  • coursera.org
  • cs50.harvard.edu (Really Good!, tech you fundamental of computer science)
  • www.codecademy.com
  • www.freecodecamp.org (Nice, they teach you a lot of technology, mainly for web.)
  • www.theodinproject.com
  • www.udemy.com (If the price of the course you want is more expensive then $12, wait until the price go down to $12 or lower)
  • www.w3schools.com (Use it as a hand book.)
  • www.pluralsight.com
  • www.datacamp.com (Nice if you doing Data Science)
Others Blogs
  • dev.to (Mainly technology stuff)
  • medium.com (have lots of categories. Technology, Life Styles â€¦.)
Communities
  • r/learnprogramming
  • r/coding (there are a lots of good reddit group)
  • The freeCodeCamp forum
  • Github also have a community
Podcasts
  • CodingBlocks Podcasts (Beginners Friendly)
  • devchat.tv list of podcasts (choose whatever you want)
  • syntax
